content: I show you my stuff with DM Scotty the fun thing I want to show you today
is this over caged cart or wagon that I made and then let me give you a little
better look at it see it's got the little beat in the back and it's got the
cage and skull on there and looks really great so let me talk about a little bit
so the cage technique you've seen me do I just did it the same way I did the
cage technique just went all the way around the wagon I put a little bit of
hay in the wagon itself with that technique I also did a hitch I just cut
some wood and the hitch attaches to some woods that I did in the bottom so these
these attached to the the wheels and then the that attaches to the hitch so
just a little bit of detail on that in case the wagon got turned over I also
added a skull this is a Games Workshop skull which I thought looked nice on the
front there and the wheels are kind of interesting the wheels aren't really a
technique I've shown before they're made out of a material called super sculpt
Lee and let me give you a look at that so here's what the super sculpey is
looks like it's um it's also like a pinkish clay and this is an oven-baked
clay so what you do is you sculpt what you're gonna do and then you put it in
the oven at 275 for like 15 minutes and then it hardens to a hard consistency
now I definitely recommend the super sculpt Lee as opposed to the regular
because the regular tends to break much easier now the wheels themselves I just
used a punch flatten out the clay used a punch punched it and then add in the
detail with that a little sculpt Lee board going across there and everything
now you can always do wheels tubing with different techniques like you know with
cardboard or the woods ease that we've used there's all kinds of ways to do
wheels but this is another way if you wanted to make an interesting wheel that
didn't look like one of those kind of things so now I've got mine that I've
got my car I needed something to pull it so I
discovered this mage Knight figure which I thought was looked great I look
suitably primitive in an ogre II awareness and the thing was it was at
was actually a dwarf thing and I had at work attached I just ripped the dwarf
off so what I did is I made the wagon so that the hitch
perfectly lines up with that the base there and then I could put a augur on it
to drive this thing so so that worked out really well it looks great so the
players could try to you know get rid of make the the animal run away or you know
it's separated from the wagon or whatever to help the help the the people
or creatures in the wagon so the wagon is the ogres were hungry so they were
trying to raid the players Kingdom and steal you know food basically so they
were after people so I had peasants that could go in that they could put in the
wagon and then the players would have to save him they were after some grains I
had like a multi-tiered encounter so they were like you know they're had the
same some peasants and then this mill and then some animals so it was a lot of
fun but one problem I ran into was it's really hard to find scale animals for
the scale but I discovered a bunch of farm animals that are actually one
sixty-fourth scale but they work really great for this for the one the 28
millimeter so here's a bunch of animals I got online I couldn't find them
locally but I did find them online and you can see how nice they look and there
they're just about the perfect scale so when the ogres were raiding they were
putting the different animals in their cart so there's goat in I have a cow and
there's their sheep and these are all pre-painted so that's really nice - I
didn't really have to paint them but I got a bunch of animals for a fairly
fairly cheap price that's a good way to get scale animals if you need them for
your games so there we go there's the there's what I want to show you this
wicked / cart that they were using to raid the
players villages and get some food so there you go and I'll see you next time
when I show you my stuff hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this
episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain for the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
you
